original_definition: 'frequency restoration reserves' means the active power reserves available to restore system frequency to the nominal frequency and, for a synchronous area consisting of more than one LFC area, to restore power balance to the scheduled value;
generated_definition: 'frequency restoration reserves' means frequency restoration reserves are a type of reserve that is used to restore the frequency of a service in the event of a failure or disruption. they are typically used in the telecommunications industry to ensure that critical services are not disrupted during a failure.

Article 3: ‘frequency restoration reserves’ or ‘FRR’ means the active power reserves available to restore system frequency to the nominal frequency and, for a synchronous area consisting of more than one LFC area, to restore power balance to the scheduled value;
